**Snickersnee** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful")-aligned, and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana").

Snickersnee deals an extra +1d8 damage to all monsters.

## Generation

In addition to random generation, Snickersnee may be given as a [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") to lawful characters, and is the first guaranteed sacrifice gift for [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai").

## Strategy

Snickersnee is a serviceable artifact weapon, if generally unremarkable - it has marginally lower damage on average compared to [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur"), with lower to-hit bonuses and no additional properties. While outclassed by Excalibur and many other artifact weapons, it is still decent as a first artifact weapon for Samurai and other lawful characters, and can at least tide them over until you are prepped to dip for Excalibur or transition to another artifact weapon.

### Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from [weapon skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), or from using a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") weapon against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") or [demons](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").

| Weapon         | Small monster                                                                                        | Large monster                                                                                        |
| -------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| +0 Snickersnee | ![\frac{1+10}{2}+\frac{1+8}{2}=\bold{10}](/images/math/7/6/3/7638416cae81248139b0c2ed3abb117a.png)   | ![\frac{1+12}{2}+\frac{1+8}{2}=\bold{11}](/images/math/a/d/5/ad528be77a74e58dbde477e6b02c962e.png)   |
| +7 Snickersnee | ![\frac{1+10}{2}+\frac{1+8}{2}+7=\bold{17}](/images/math/2/e/f/2ef88da7e9958fb6abb983a5d1640602.png) | ![\frac{1+12}{2}+\frac{1+8}{2}+7=\bold{18}](/images/math/1/6/6/166a6322799ba56af755c2295d7dc14e.png) |

## History

Snickersnee first appears in [NetHack 2.2a](/wiki/NetHack_2.2a "NetHack 2.2a") - in this versions and [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), any katana can be [named](/wiki/Name "Name") Snickersnee, and it has a +d5 damage bonus against all monsters.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), artifacts are made unique, and Snickersnee is given its modern traits.

## Origin

Snickersnee is derived from *[The Mikado](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Mikado "wikipedia:The Mikado")*, a popular 19th century comic opera set in Japan. Its name is actually an archaic English word for "large knife", deriving from a Dutch phrase meaning *to stab or cut*. The word originally described a style of knife-fighting (analogous to *cut and thrust* in English), and later came to refer to the knives used in such fights.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), due to artifact weapon changes Snickersnee now has a flat +8 damage bonus, making it significantly more powerful than in vanilla. Additionally, since artifacts can be #[twoweaponed](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"), a Samurai who finds a long sword can get easy access to both Excalibur and Snickersnee, which makes for a formidable combination well into the late game.

#### Damage calculations

| Weapon         | Small monster                                                                              | Large monster                                                                              |
| -------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| +0 Snickersnee | ![\frac{1+10}{2}+8=\bold{13.5}](/images/math/0/8/9/089756f8d2436c53eb8518f0fc0f0922.png)   | ![\frac{1+12}{2}+8=\bold{14.5}](/images/math/8/c/9/8c94caa29ee50696b1da78116c3b8dc3.png)   |
| +7 Snickersnee | ![\frac{1+10}{2}+8+7=\bold{20.5}](/images/math/1/1/c/11ca71a52d524d24c9df183aa27c2f31.png) | ![\frac{1+12}{2}+8+7=\bold{21.5}](/images/math/c/6/1/c61ebf6f78e0ad5e9695fea637ceb509.png) |

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), Snickersnee gains +1d5 to hit (in addition to the +1 for being a [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana")), but is otherwise unchanged. This is more significant than it might initially seem because of the to-hit calculation changes in SporkHack.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), Snickersnee is much different from vanilla. It is an intelligent [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai")-favoring artifact [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") with doubled base dice (i.e. 2d5 versus small monsters and 2d3 versus large monsters), +1d3 to-hit, and deals +1d10 damage versus all monsters. Snickersnee cannot be gifted at all, but is nameable by [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") who have either finished their [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") or reached [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 19; [Kiku-ichimonji](/wiki/Kiku-ichimonji "Kiku-ichimonji") replaces Snickersnee as the Samurai's first gift. Both Tourists and Samurai can [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") Snickersnee in the off-hand, but will suffer a -20 to-hit penalty unless they are Skilled in twoweapon.

Snickersnee has a chance of [beheading](/wiki/Beheading "Beheading") its target similar to [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade"), and also shares Vorpal Blade's [exploding dice](/wiki/Exploding_dice "Exploding dice"): If any of its base weapon damage dice roll their maximum damage value, a bonus roll is made with the same-size die (i.e. 1d5 or 1d3) with a flat +1 bonus applied, and the result is added to its damage - if *that* die then rolls its maximum value, another such roll is made, and so on until the die rolls stop "exploding". There is also a +1 damage bonus per base dice (+2 damage in total), even if neither die explodes. This can result in absurdly high-damage strikes with Snickersnee (at least in theory), independent of the high-damage "vorpal blows" that the artifact is already capable of.

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds Kiku-ichimonji from dNetHack, which replaces Snickersnee as the first sacrifice gift for Samurai.

Snickersnee is one of the many artifacts that can be requested from [Duri](/wiki/Duri "Duri") at [The Forge](/wiki/The_Forge "The Forge") if it has not generated during a game.

## Encyclopedia entry

Ah, never shall I forget the cry,  
or the shriek that shrieked he,  
As I gnashed my teeth, and from my sheath  
I drew my Snickersnee!  
\--Koko, Lord high executioner of Titipu

\[ The Mikado, by Sir W\.S. Gilbert ]
